TopicTitle: Need help with a FNAF fan game

Articles.Content:
I need help with designing the game. For example 3D modeling and animation with frames. I can do the coding.

I'm using clickteam fusion 2.5 full edition if someone could help me for free (I know there no money ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) but I just need help with designing and **Ã¢â‚¬â€¹THIS IS NOT A ADVERTISEMENT! This is just a message.**

 Please contact me at [\[email protected\]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#e98c99808a918e88848c9a9c9a868f8f808a8885a981869d84888085c78a8684) for more information and do not PM or spam to get attention please.

SEE YOU THERE! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

No..... Unless you have new gameplay. Like a shotgun to avoid jumpscares. And you can walk. Or make it Friday nights at Freddie's: eat pizza, be MLG pro, be friends with the robots, and basically be FNAF sandbox edition with built-in pyro visionpyro vision

Ummm...did I break the KSP community or something? Is everyone obsessed with talking about FNaF now?

Like megatiger said, you better bring something new to the gaming community or no one will take the time to look at your game. I know it's harsh, but that's the reality of the industry. Put a spin on current lore, make players think, avoid making the mistakes that turned so many people away form the original FNaF games.

> 
> Ummm...did I break the KSP community or something? Is everyone obsessed with talking about FNaF now?
> Like megatiger said, you better bring something new to the gaming community or no one will take the time to look at your game. I know it's harsh, but that's the reality of the industry. Put a spin on current lore, make players think, avoid making the mistakes that turned so many people away form the original FNaF games.

Well that and copyright laws
